intro: Pappophorum brachystachyum, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed pappophorum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces lightweight seeds with tufts of hair, which aid in wind dispersal. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ecological role and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
